web.title: Monetary Policy
web.text: Monetary policy in Singapore is centred on managing the trade-weighted exchange rate with the objective to ensure price stability over the medium term.

web.title: How does MAS carry out monetary policy?
web.text: MAS has conducted monetary policy by managing the Singapore dollar exchange rate. MAS does not control domestic interest rates or money supply growth.

web.title: Monetary Policy Framework - Monetary Authority of Singapore
web.text: Monetary policy in Singapore is centred on the exchange rate. In the small and open Singapore economy, the exchange rate is the more effective ...

web.title: What is MAS' monetary policy framework and its rationale?
web.text: At each monetary policy review, MAS formulates monetary policy by setting a path for the S$NEER policy band to ensure price stability in the medium term.

web.title: How does MAS carry out its monetary policy?
web.text: Monetary policy in Singapore is carried out in three stages. The first stage is the formulation of monetary policy by the Economic Policy Group (EPG) at MAS.

web.title: Singapore's Exchange Rate-Based Monetary Policy
web.text: Since 1981, monetary policy in Singapore has been centred on the management of the exchange rate. The primary objective is to promote price stability.

web.text: Monetary policy refers to the actions taken by central banks to affect monetary and financial conditions in order to achieve broad macroeconomic objectives.
